thread.title: PSNI issue warning to drivers of traffic delays across Northern Ireland this weekend - Belfast Live
thread.title_full: PSNI issue warning to drivers of traffic delays across Northern Ireland this weekend - Belfast Live

author: Nadia Breen
title: PSNI issue warning to drivers of traffic delays across Northern Ireland this weekend - Belfast Live
text:
News PSNI issue warning to drivers of traffic delays across Northern Ireland this weekend The locations that will be impacted include Newtownards and Ballygowan
belfastlive Bookmark
Share
Comments
News By Nadia Breen Sophie McLaughlin 21:39, 8 AUG 2024 Bookmark
Stock PSNI image (Image: Jonathan Porter/PressEye) Road users are being advised to expect traffic delays this weekend across the country.
The PSNI has advised drivers to expect the delays on Saturday, August 10, due to planned parades taking place.
Parades are planned for Derry City and Strabane, Ards and North Down, Mid and East Antrim and Lisburn and Castlereagh.
READ MORE: Translink issue update on services ahead of weekend protests
READ MORE: Single biggest loyal orders parade set for Derry this weekend
Here is what the PSNI have advised in each area:
Derry City and Strabane "Please be aware of traffic disruption in the city centre of Derry/Londonderry from around 9am on Saturday 10th August when the Apprentice Boys of Derry (ABoD) parade takes place in the city.
"Diversions will be in place from approximately 11am on Saturday. The top deck of Craigavon Bridge will be closed from this time as it is part of the main parade route.
"Drivers travelling from the Limavady direction, towards Strabane, will be diverted at Caw Roundabout via Crescent Link towards Newbuildings. Traffic bound for the Cityside should use the Foyle Bridge. Motorists travelling from Strabane, towards Limavady, will be diverted at Newbuildings towards Altnagelvin. Motorists can also travel via Lifford into the city via Letterkenny Road.
"Road closures will remain in place until the main parade and associated feeder parades are complete."
Mid and East Antrim "Road users are being advised to expect traffic delays this Saturday, 10th August across Mid and East Antrim, due to planned parades taking place.
"The locations that will be impacted include Ballyclare, Larne and Carrickfergus, with parades in these areas starting at 7am until 12 noon, then beginning again at 5pm before finishing at approximately 9pm.
"The parade routes in each location incorporate most of the town centres, with a large number of participants and spectators expected.
"Officers will be on the ground in the areas mentioned to accommodate the flow of traffic and to assist with diversions. However, to avoid potential delays if you do not plan on attending, please seek an alternative route for your journey if possible."
Ards and North Down The locations that will be impacted include Newtownards and Ballygowan, with parades in these areas starting at 7am until 12 noon, then beginning again at 5pm before finishing at approximately 9pm.
"The parade routes in each location incorporate most of the town centres, with a large number of participants and spectators expected.
"Officers will be on the ground in the areas mentioned to accommodate the flow of traffic and to assist with diversions.
"However, to avoid potential delays if you do not plan on attending, please seek an alternative route for your journey if possible."
Lisburn and Castlereagh "Road users are being advised to expect traffic delays this Saturday, 10th August across Lisburn and Castlereagh, due to planned parades taking place.
"The locations that will be impacted include Lisburn and Dundonald, with parades in these areas starting at 7am until 12 noon, then beginning again at 5pm before finishing at approximately 9pm.
"The parade routes in each location incorporate most of the town and city centres, with a large number of participants and spectators expected.
Officers will be on the ground in the areas mentioned to accommodate the flow of traffic and to assist with diversions. However, to avoid potential delays if you do not plan on attending, please seek an alternative route for your journey if possible."
